thread.title: Illinois confirms Ferguson will miss game at No. 22 Iowa
thread.title_full: Illinois confirms Ferguson will miss game at No. 22 Iowa

title: Illinois confirms Ferguson will miss game at No. 22 Iowa
text:
Illini back Ferguson out with shoulder injury for game at No. 22 Iowa THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 08, 2015 - 8:38 pmLast Updated: October 08, 2015 - 8:39 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 
Illinois (1014) 

CHAMPAIGN, Illinois — Illinois says starting running back Josh Ferguson will miss Saturday's game at No. 22 Iowa with a shoulder injury. 
Interim coach Bill Cubit had said earlier this week that he doubted Ferguson would play. 
Ferguson injured the shoulder early in Illinois' 14-13 win over Nebraska and did not return. The senior has 397 yards and three touchdowns on 71 carries for the Illini (4-1, 1-0 Big Ten). 
Freshman Ke'Shawn Vaughn took over for Ferguson on Saturday and was the only other Illini back to carry the ball. Vaughn had 98 yards on 24 carries. 
Cubit has said Illinois will need junior Henry Enyenihi to help pick up the rushing load at Iowa (5-0, 1-0).
